title: Calories in Red Onion
meta_description: Discover calories in red onion per medium serving, plus carbs, fiber, protein, fat, and nutrition tweaks for recipes.
assumptions: Raw, medium-sized red onion (about 110 g), peeled and sliced.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by size, variety, freshness, and preparation method. Check labels or databases for specifics.

quick_answer.text: One medium raw red onion provides about 44 kcal and 10 g carbs.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories in one medium red onion?
faqs.a: About 44 kcal for a medium raw red onion (110 g).

faqs.q: Are red onions low in calories?
faqs.a: Yes, around 40 kcal per 100 g, mostly from natural sugars and carbs.

faqs.q: What's the carb content in red onion?
faqs.a: Approximately 9.3 g carbs per 100 g, including 1.7 g fiber.

faqs.q: Do red onions have protein or fat?
faqs.a: Low amounts: 1.1 g protein and 0.1 g fat per 100 g.

faqs.q: How does cooking affect calories in red onion?
faqs.a: Cooking methods like sautéing add calories from oil; boiling or raw keeps them low.
